page.title: 03Ancient history
page.content: The name Paull is Anglian,which perhaps refers to a stake or land mark near a river.Part of the village was known as Paull Fleet by the mid thirteenth century with the reference either to the Humber or Hedon Haven. By the fourteenth century another part was called Over Paull and later the area near the creek was called Low Paull. Paull Holme is a Scandinavian name, probably it refers to a high well drained site. The Parish included the hamlet of Thorngumbald and for ecclesiastical purposes the hamlet of Camerton. The village was depopulated in the late middle ages and a grange was established in the south east of the parish.
